title: Strawberry Fields Forever
body:
BTS au one-shot

Taehyung x Reader Y/N

Fluff, Romance

Word Count: 2,090

A/N: Listened to 4 o’clock over and over while writing this.

gif by @kungjungkook

It’s a sound you haven’t heard in years. How many? Gosh, it must have been at least six. And yet you know exactly who is making it the moment you hear the first tick of a pebble hitting your window pane. At first you think you’re imagining it but there’s no mistaking it’s real when the second rock strikes the glass.

“There’s no way,” you whisper to yourself as you set your laptop down on your comforter and get up off your bed. Two more rocks hit your window as you make your way over to it to peer out. Of course being eleven o’ clock at night and living miles out of the city and away from the lights, it’s pitch black outside. But as your eyes adjust to the darkness, you see a figure standing below your window in your gravel driveway. The figure is taller than you remember but the way he stands makes him undeniably familiar.

“Tae,” you whisper, his name bringing a smile to your lips.

The figure takes a step closer to the house triggering the motion sensor and suddenly the gravel driveway is flooded with cold light.

If you had any doubts about who it was a minute ago, you don’t now as he steps into the light, his face stretched into his familiar rectangular grin. He lifts a hand and gives you a small wave. You lift your own in reply before rushing to grab a jacket and making your way downstairs—quietly so as to not disturb your parents—and then outside.

He’s waiting there in the driveway, his hands stuffed into the pockets of a very expensive looking jacket. His hair is longer and silvery brown, his body broader—though still lanky—his face leaner, sharper, features less boyish and more manly. He’s changed so much yet you still see hints of the boy you grew up with in his smile and by the spark of childish curiosity in his brown eyes. Fame hasn’t changed him completely, it seems.

With a squeal, you run off your porch, throwing your arms around his neck as you crash into him. He laughs against your ear as he lifts you into the air and swings you around. “What are you doing here?” you ask, goosebumps raising on your skin from the sensation of his breath on your neck.

“We’re on vacation so I’m in town for a few days visiting family,” he says. “I heard you were home from school and I couldn’t resist stopping by.”

“In the middle of the night?”

“Just like old times,” Taehyung replies, then his eyes drift down to your slippered feet. “Nice jammies,” he says.

“Nice shoes,” you retort and lift an eyebrow. “Gucci?”

Taehyung shrugs.

“Not quite like old times, huh?” you ask, your voice a little quieter.

“I guess.”

The air is cold even for it being the middle of summer and the thin hoodie you grabbed doesn’t quite protect you from it. “So…how’ve you been?” you finally ask him, kicking at the gravel with the toe of your slipper.

Taehyung knocks his shoe against yours. “Good,” he says. “Busy.”

“No kidding,” you say with a chuckle. “I saw all of your performances and interviews from when you were in America. Did you even have time to sleep?”

“I managed to get a few minutes on the car rides,” he says and gives you a smirk. You shake your head.

“So you’re on vacation and instead of sleeping, you’re throwing rocks at my window? Are you crazy?” you ask nudging him with your elbow. That’s when you notice the small paper sack sitting on the ground beside his foot. Your eyes grow wide as you meet his and smile. “Are those…?”

Taehyung nods and picks the bag up. “Shall we?” he asks offering you his arm.

“Heck yes!” you reply and hook your own arm through his.

*

You loved growing up in the country. A farmer’s daughter, you used to skip through the fields, picking and eating the sun-ripened fruits and vegetables directly off the plants—even after your father told you countless times not to. The tomatoes were juicy, the carrots sweet, the radishes spicy. But nothing compared to the strawberries grown by the family that lived next door.

You used to sneak under the fence, sprinting as fast as your little legs could go and then snatching up as many berries as your hands could carry before running back to the safety of your side of the fence. You were able to do that only a few times before you were inevitably caught. Though the one that caught you couldn’t do much more than tattle as he was only a year older than you, and slower. Eventually he realized his snitching wasn’t deterring you and started helping you instead find the ripest, biggest ones. Then the two of you would sit on your own sides of the fence, your loot pile between you as you partook in your little feast.

One summer night when you were around thirteen, you happened to be looking out your bedroom window, which faced the strawberry fields, and caught sight of Taehyung laying in the dirt among the plants, his lanky form dusted with moonlight. You decided to cross over the fence line and join him, not saying a word as you lay down beside him. The two of you stayed that way for almost an hour, staring up at the stars that peppered the cobalt blue sky. Where you live, miles from the city, you don’t see the stars. You see galaxies. And so almost every night of that summer, the two of you met out in the strawberry fields and gazed up at the galaxies together.

The following summer, your were fourteen and he was fifteen, and while the night sky was magical and deserving of being admired in silence, the two of you instead lay sprawled on your backs, a small paper bag of strawberries sitting between you, your conversations and loud laughter filling the night air. One night, you felt his fingers brush yours and though you didn’t pull your hand away, you didn’t show a reaction either. That was the last summer you did this together, as the next one he was gone, living in a big city far away, unknowingly training to someday become a member of the biggest boy band in the world.

*

In the dark, your slipper finds a rock sticking out of the dirt and you stumble, Taehyung quickly shooting a hand out to grab you before you fall. The sounds of your giggling echo through the field as you regain your balance and continue on with him.

“Are you sure you weren’t up there getting wasted before I showed up?” he asks through his own laughter.

“Hey, these things are not the easiest to maneuver uneven terrain in,” you respond. Neither of you have even acknowledged the fact that your hands are still clasped. “Maybe you should let me borrow those babies,” you add gesturing to his expensive shoes. “I bet they cost more than my tuition.”

Taehyung scoffs but doesn’t respond with a sarcastic remark like you expected him to. Well, crap, now you feel bad. Suddenly, he stops walking, looking back the way you came and then up at the sky. “This seems like a good spot,” he says then sits down on the ground and sets the paper bag down beside him.

You stand there for a minute chewing on your bottom lip thoughtfully. The fact that he’s willing to dirty his designer clothes probably because he can afford to just buy more isn’t lost on you. But of course as soon as that thought enters your mind, a rush of guilt stabs you in the chest. How dare you think such a thing about Taehyung? He’s done nothing to deserve such judgement. Besides being an idol, he’s still your Taehyung. Just a boy sitting in the dirt, moonlight tracing his features, a hint of his boxy grin playing on his lips as he looks up at you expectantly.

“Y/N?” he says, “Are you going to sit down?”

At last you snap out of your thoughts. “What? Yeah, sorry,” you say before plopping down next to him. As you do, your arm bumps the bag and it falls over with a heavy thunk. You glance up at Taehyung and raise an eyebrow. “Those are some heavy strawberries, huh?”

Taehyung’s smile widens as he reaches into the bag and pulls out a bottle. “I figured we’ve graduated to Champagne and strawberries this summer.”

“Ooh,” you say bouncing your knees excitedly. “I feel so grown up.”

“If I were really grown up, I would have thought to bring glasses,” Taehyung says and pops the top off with a bottle opener.

You grab the bottle from him. “Eh, I’m a college student,” you say then take a swig. The alcohol comes alive in your mouth, tingling over your tongue before fizzing its way down your throat. You feel warmth begin to bloom in your stomach as you pass the bottle back to him. “Maybe next summer we can graduate again to glasses.”

Taehyung points the neck of the bottle your way, “cheers to that,” he says before tipping his head back and taking a big drink of his own. His face contorts into a sour expression before he’s able to swallow. “That is terrible,” he croaks and you promptly burst out laughing. “Strawberry, stat!”

While you’re still trying to get your laughter back under control, you reach into the bag and pull out a berry. He quickly snatches it out of your hand and pops the whole thing into his mouth, his cheeks expanding to their fullest as he chews on it. Suddenly, a thoughtful expression falls over his face and he nods slowly as he continues chewing the berry.

“Not bad,” he finally says. “Champagne with a strawberry chaser, who knew?” Then he shoves the bottle back into your hand. “Try it.”

You can’t help but laugh again. “Champagne and strawberries together? How has no one ever thought of that before?”

The two of you continue passing the bottle back and forth and before too long, it and the berries are gone and you feel weightless. You run your tongue across your lower lip, catching some of the juice that has dried as you look up at the stars. They seem brighter. Closer somehow. Curiously, you lift your arm up, watching your fingers as they flex, as if you can almost hook one around one of those glittering sparks above you. Out of the corner of your eye, you see another arm stretch up then reach over, fingers grasping your own.

For a moment, you study the two hands, silhouetted against the blue. Watch the fingers brush and then intertwine, palms pressing together. When you do finally tear your eyes away from the sight and turn your head, Taehyung is looking back at you.

“Do you remember when we were younger and we were out here looking up at the stars and I touched your hand?” His voice is so low it comes out as barely more than a whisper.

You nod your head.

“And you didn’t say anything. And you didn’t do anything.” Then he swallows thickly. “Why didn’t you do anything?”

You close your eyes and pull his hand down so you’re holding it against your stomach. “It was perfect, Tae,” you whisper back. “We were just young and those nights we would meet and look up at the stars together were perfect. And I think I was afraid that they would end if anything between us changed.” Then you open your eyes again. “And if anything changed then, who knows where we would be now?”

“Probably not here.”

“No, probably not.”

Taehyung bites his lip thoughtfully, his eyes traveling down to where his hand rests entwined with yours on your stomach. “But what about now?”

You look up again at the stars and they wink back as if they just shared their deepest secrets with you. As if they’ve known all along what it has taken you many years to realize on your own. Then with a smile, you meet Taehyung’s eyes again. “I think change is good,” you say.

That’s all he needs to hear before leaning in to press his lips to yours and instead of the two of you admiring the galaxies in the night sky, the galaxies admire the two of you.

But of course as soon as that thought enters your mind, a rush of guilt stabs you in the chest. How dare you think such a thing about Taehyung? He’s done nothing to deserve such judgement. Besides being an idol, he’s still your Taehyung. Just a boy sitting in the dirt, moonlight tracing his features, a hint of his boxy grin playing on his lips as he looks up at you expectantly.

“Y/N?” he says, “Are you going to sit down?”

At last you snap out of your thoughts. “What? Yeah, sorry,” you say before plopping down next to him. As you do, your arm bumps the bag and it falls over with a heavy thunk. You glance up at Taehyung and raise an eyebrow. “Those are some heavy strawberries, huh?”

Taehyung’s smile widens as he reaches into the bag and pulls out a bottle. “I figured we’ve graduated to Champagne and strawberries this summer.”

“Ooh,” you say bouncing your knees excitedly. “I feel so grown up.”

“If I were really grown up, I would have thought to bring glasses,” Taehyung says and pops the top off with a bottle opener.

You grab the bottle from him. “Eh, I’m a college student,” you say then take a swig. The alcohol comes alive in your mouth, tingling over your tongue before fizzing its way down your throat. You feel warmth begin to bloom in your stomach as you pass the bottle back to him. “Maybe next summer we can graduate again to glasses.”

Taehyung points the neck of the bottle your way, “cheers to that,” he says before tipping his head back and taking a big drink of his own. His face contorts into a sour expression before he’s able to swallow. “That is terrible,” he croaks and you promptly burst out laughing. “Strawberry, stat!”

While you’re still trying to get your laughter back under control, you reach into the bag and pull out a berry. He quickly snatches it out of your hand and pops the whole thing into his mouth, his cheeks expanding to their fullest as he chews on it. Suddenly, a thoughtful expression falls over his face and he nods slowly as he continues chewing the berry.

“Not bad,” he finally says. “Champagne with a strawberry chaser, who knew?” Then he shoves the bottle back into your hand. “Try it.”

You can’t help but laugh again. “Champagne and strawberries together? How has no one ever thought of that before?”

The two of you continue passing the bottle back and forth and before too long, it and the berries are gone and you feel weightless. You run your tongue across your lower lip, catching some of the juice that has dried as you look up at the stars. They seem brighter. Closer somehow. Curiously, you lift your arm up, watching your fingers as they flex, as if you can almost hook one around one of those glittering sparks above you. Out of the corner of your eye, you see another arm stretch up then reach over, fingers grasping your own.

For a moment, you study the two hands, silhouetted against the blue. Watch the fingers brush and then intertwine, palms pressing together. When you do finally tear your eyes away from the sight and turn your head, Taehyung is looking back at you.

“Do you remember when we were younger and we were out here looking up at the stars and I touched your hand?” His voice is so low it comes out as barely more than a whisper.

You nod your head.

“And you didn’t say anything. And you didn’t do anything.” Then he swallows thickly. “Why didn’t you do anything?”

You close your eyes and pull his hand down so you’re holding it against your stomach. “It was perfect, Tae,” you whisper back. “We were just young and those nights we would meet and look up at the stars together were perfect. And I think I was afraid that they would end if anything between us changed.” Then you open your eyes again. “And if anything changed then, who knows where we would be now?”

“Probably not here.”

“No, probably not.”

Taehyung bites his lip thoughtfully, his eyes traveling down to where his hand rests entwined with yours on your stomach. “But what about now?”

You look up again at the stars and they wink back as if they just shared their deepest secrets with you. As if they’ve known all along what it has taken you many years to realize on your own. Then with a smile, you meet Taehyung’s eyes again. “I think change is good,” you say.

That’s all he needs to hear before leaning in to press his lips to yours and instead of the two of you admiring the galaxies in the night sky, the galaxies admire the two of you.

It’s a sound you haven’t heard in years. How many? Gosh, it must have been at least six. And yet you know exactly who is making it the moment you hear the first tick of a pebble hitting your window pane. At first you think you’re imagining it but there’s no mistaking it’s real when the second rock strikes the glass.

“There’s no way,” you whisper to yourself as you set your laptop down on your comforter and get up off your bed. Two more rocks hit your window as you make your way over to it to peer out. Of course being eleven o’ clock at night and living miles out of the city and away from the lights, it’s pitch black outside. But as your eyes adjust to the darkness, you see a figure standing below your window in your gravel driveway. The figure is taller than you remember but the way he stands makes him undeniably familiar.

“Tae,” you whisper, his name bringing a smile to your lips.

The figure takes a step closer to the house triggering the motion sensor and suddenly the gravel driveway is flooded with cold light.

If you had any doubts about who it was a minute ago, you don’t now as he steps into the light, his face stretched into his familiar rectangular grin. He lifts a hand and gives you a small wave. You lift your own in reply before rushing to grab a jacket and making your way downstairs—quietly so as to not disturb your parents—and then outside.

He’s waiting there in the driveway, his hands stuffed into the pockets of a very expensive looking jacket. His hair is longer and silvery brown, his body broader—though still lanky—his face leaner, sharper, features less boyish and more manly. He’s changed so much yet you still see hints of the boy you grew up with in his smile and by the spark of childish curiosity in his brown eyes. Fame hasn’t changed him completely, it seems.

With a squeal, you run off your porch, throwing your arms around his neck as you crash into him. He laughs against your ear as he lifts you into the air and swings you around. “What are you doing here?” you ask, goosebumps raising on your skin from the sensation of his breath on your neck.

“We’re on vacation so I’m in town for a few days visiting family,” he says. “I heard you were home from school and I couldn’t resist stopping by.”

“In the middle of the night?”

“Just like old times,” Taehyung replies, then his eyes drift down to your slippered feet. “Nice jammies,” he says.

“Nice shoes,” you retort and lift an eyebrow. “Gucci?”

Taehyung shrugs.

“Not quite like old times, huh?” you ask, your voice a little quieter.

“I guess.”

The air is cold even for it being the middle of summer and the thin hoodie you grabbed doesn’t quite protect you from it. “So…how’ve you been?” you finally ask him, kicking at the gravel with the toe of your slipper.

Taehyung knocks his shoe against yours. “Good,” he says. “Busy.”

“No kidding,” you say with a chuckle. “I saw all of your performances and interviews from when you were in America. Did you even have time to sleep?”

“I managed to get a few minutes on the car rides,” he says and gives you a smirk. You shake your head.

“So you’re on vacation and instead of sleeping, you’re throwing rocks at my window? Are you crazy?” you ask nudging him with your elbow. That’s when you notice the small paper sack sitting on the ground beside his foot. Your eyes grow wide as you meet his and smile. “Are those…?”

Taehyung nods and picks the bag up. “Shall we?” he asks offering you his arm.

“Heck yes!” you reply and hook your own arm through his.

*

You loved growing up in the country. A farmer’s daughter, you used to skip through the fields, picking and eating the sun-ripened fruits and vegetables directly off the plants—even after your father told you countless times not to. The tomatoes were juicy, the carrots sweet, the radishes spicy. But nothing compared to the strawberries grown by the family that lived next door.

You used to sneak under the fence, sprinting as fast as your little legs could go and then snatching up as many berries as your hands could carry before running back to the safety of your side of the fence. You were able to do that only a few times before you were inevitably caught. Though the one that caught you couldn’t do much more than tattle as he was only a year older than you, and slower. Eventually he realized his snitching wasn’t deterring you and started helping you instead find the ripest, biggest ones. Then the two of you would sit on your own sides of the fence, your loot pile between you as you partook in your little feast.

One summer night when you were around thirteen, you happened to be looking out your bedroom window, which faced the strawberry fields, and caught sight of Taehyung laying in the dirt among the plants, his lanky form dusted with moonlight. You decided to cross over the fence line and join him, not saying a word as you lay down beside him. The two of you stayed that way for almost an hour, staring up at the stars that peppered the cobalt blue sky. Where you live, miles from the city, you don’t see the stars. You see galaxies. And so almost every night of that summer, the two of you met out in the strawberry fields and gazed up at the galaxies together.

The following summer, your were fourteen and he was fifteen, and while the night sky was magical and deserving of being admired in silence, the two of you instead lay sprawled on your backs, a small paper bag of strawberries sitting between you, your conversations and loud laughter filling the night air. One night, you felt his fingers brush yours and though you didn’t pull your hand away, you didn’t show a reaction either. That was the last summer you did this together, as the next one he was gone, living in a big city far away, unknowingly training to someday become a member of the biggest boy band in the world.

*

In the dark, your slipper finds a rock sticking out of the dirt and you stumble, Taehyung quickly shooting a hand out to grab you before you fall. The sounds of your giggling echo through the field as you regain your balance and continue on with him.

“Are you sure you weren’t up there getting wasted before I showed up?” he asks through his own laughter.

“Hey, these things are not the easiest to maneuver uneven terrain in,” you respond. Neither of you have even acknowledged the fact that your hands are still clasped. “Maybe you should let me borrow those babies,” you add gesturing to his expensive shoes. “I bet they cost more than my tuition.”

Taehyung scoffs but doesn’t respond with a sarcastic remark like you expected him to. Well, crap, now you feel bad. He quickly snatches it out of your hand and pops the whole thing into his mouth, his cheeks expanding to their fullest as he chews on it. Suddenly, a thoughtful expression falls over his face and he nods slowly as he continues chewing the berry.

BTS during a zombie apocalypse

Seokjin

  • the “Mother” survivor
  • all they do is nag and complain
  • “I told you, only 3 meals a day! You guys are wasting supplies!”
  • but is actually helpful ASF
  • and compassionate
  • grows food for the group
  • is a doctor/nurse
  • secretly in love with the leader of the group
  • was the 2nd member of the group
  • how they die: helping a child or a group member

Yoongi

  • The “Solo” Survivor
  • not talkative, keeps to themselves, is a mystery
  • 5th member of the group
  • their motto: every man for himself
  • will literally kill you to save their own ass
  • makes you wonder is they are actually on your side
  • always has spare supplies hidden away
  • RUTHLESS
  • “if you slow me down, i’ll kill you”
  • only person they care about besides themselves: the “Angel” survivor (secretly dating them)
  • is actually a good person, just can’t trust others easily
  • how they die: they randomly disappear so no one ever knows if they are really dead

Namjoon

  • The “Brains” of the Survivors
  • aka the leader
  • has brilliant plans and lots of hacks that help the group survive
  • is the most protective of the group
  • secretly in love with the “Mother” of the group
  • strong, encouraging, and really philosophical
  • knows EVERYTHING
  • how they die: they don’t. duh.

Hoseok

  • The “Terrified” Survivor
  • you have no fucking idea how they lasted this long
  • 4th member of the group
  • never really helps fight zombies
  • but is a good listener and helps other ways
  • actually very kind and trustworthy
  • vaules friendship and is genuine
  • but makes mistakes the group has to pay for
  • causes others to die
  • and almost dies every other day
  • pessimistic

blog.description: Masterlist Request Rules Ship Rules I'm a horror and smut kpop blog When talking to me call me babygirl or mommy if you comfortable with it I write Reactions Fics for Kpop groups BTS GOT7 Blackpink Gidle Sunmi Kim Dong Han  CLC EXID I also do ships fake snaps and fake texts

summary: Sweeties you know I try to be nice and level-headed as possible
title: Sweeties you know I try to be nice and level-headed as possible
body: but when I get attacked for literal the same thing other people do I draw the line. I wrote many times why I create the content that I do. It isn’t just for you, babies. I find it fun and liberating. It was hard and still is a bit hard to come to terms with my fetishes because of being a victim. I write smut because I want to escape and hone my writing skills. I want to practice my fetishes in a safe environment. I started writing smut to get out of the sexually abusive relationship I was in and in a better one even if it was at first in my imagination. I thank got7 and bts every day for making music and making me feel like life is worth living.  IF I DIDN’T HAVE THIS BLOG, YOU BABIES, and KPOP I would be dead by now. It isn’t being dramatic it is the truth. After my second attempt on my life, I found BTS again and I found got7. Then I found this community and writing again. Thank you for letting me help you and pursue my passion as a writer. I love you, babies. To all the people who don’t like my content just stay away from me. It is as good as that. WRITING TO ME IS LIKE MAKING MUSIC IS TO JACKSON
